content.description: Make your way up into the awesome splitter finger crack. Mantle up on a large ledge and head left into a hand/fist crack for ~15 feet until it deposits you on another ledge. Belay here if you are doing it in two pitches, otherwise make your way up to the obvious roof/flake and jam and layback your way to the top!
content.protection: Nuts, finger size cams, 1-3 (Two 3s if you are linking the two pitches, a 4 would also work).
content.location: Find the splitter finger crack ~20 feet up.

content.description:
A fun and sometimes awkward climb that you will want to pitch out due to rope drag.

First pitch - Find two bolts close to the base, once you've clipped the second bolt you will run into a horizontal crack (pro) and then two more bolts before reaching a finger crack. Follow the finger crack until it deposits you on a large ledge - head right and belay around the corner.

Second pitch - you have two options for this short section. keeping the grade low, follow the slab up to a crumbly looking crack (it's actually more solid than it looks). Following the crack right, under the roof, pick your way up the path of least resistance.
content.location: Find two bolts that trend rightward at the base of the route.

climbs.name: Ring of Fire
climbs.fa: Bob Loomis, 4/4/2004, seconded by Bob Ordner

content.description: Make your way up to the obvious roof that is split by a crack. Pull the roof directly or move out left for some good feet. Find a few good ring locks and mantle up and left to a bolted anchor (Possible to skip the belay and link the two pitches). Plug a few more small cams until you run into some glue-in bolts. Follow the bolts past a very cool series of big moves on jugs.
content.location: Find the obvious roof that is split by a crack.

content.description: A short and bouldery finish to the route 'Salsa'
content.location: Climb the first pitch of Salsa
